TypeSignature.Value: .class nested public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit FabricClient/ClusterManagementClient extends System.Object

summary.para: Represents the cluster management client for performing cluster maintenance operations.

remarks.para: The provides APIs which help to manage the cluster as a whole. These are typically administrative commands which relate to major cluster events such as the loss of nodes and the need to recover services in the case of major failures.

MemberSignature.Value: public System.Threading.Tasks.Task ActivateNodeAsync (string nodeName);
.method public hidebysig instance class System.Threading.Tasks.Task ActivateNodeAsync(string nodeName) cil managed
Public Function ActivateNodeAsync (nodeName As String) As Task
member this.ActivateNodeAsync : string -> System.Threading.Tasks.Task

param.name: nodeName
param.para: The Node to be Activated.

summary.para: Activates a Service Fabric cluster node which is currently deactivated.

returns.para: A Task that represents the asynchronous acknowledgment of the request.

remarks.para: Once activated, the node will again become a viable target for placing new replicas, and any closed replicas remaining on the node will be opened.

When this API completes it implies that the intent to activate has been registered by the system. It does not mean that the activation is complete. The progress of the operation can be determined by using the API

exception.para: See for handling common FabricClient failures.
See for handling common FabricClient failures.
See also for handling common FabricClient failures.

public void CopyClusterPackage (string imageStoreConnectionString, string clusterManifestPath, string clusterManifestPathInImageStore, string codePackagePath, string codePackagePathInImageStore);

.method public hidebysig instance void CopyClusterPackage(string imageStoreConnectionString, string clusterManifestPath, string clusterManifestPathInImageStore, string codePackagePath, string codePackagePathInImageStore) cil managed

Public Sub CopyClusterPackage (imageStoreConnectionString As String, clusterManifestPath As String, clusterManifestPathInImageStore As String, codePackagePath As String, codePackagePathInImageStore As String)
member this.CopyClusterPackage : string * string * string * string * string -> unit

param.name: imageStoreConnectionString
param.para: The connection string for the image store, which should match the "ImageStoreConnectionString" setting value found in the cluster manifest of the target cluster. In an on-premise cluster, the value is chosen during initial deployment by the cluster administrator. In an Azure cluster created through the Azure Resource Manager, this value is "fabric:ImageStore". The image store connection string value can be checked by looking at the cluster manifest contents returned by .

param.name: clusterManifestPath
param.para: The full path to the cluster manifest file to be copied.

param.name: clusterManifestPathInImageStore
param.para: The relative path along with the file name of the destination in the image store. This parameter is required when clusterManifestPath is specified. This path is created relative to the root directory in the image store and used as the destination for the cluster manifest copy.

param.name: codePackagePath
param.para: The full path to the Service Fabric code package to be copied.

param.name: codePackagePathInImageStore
param.para: The relative path along with the file name of the destination in the image store. This parameter is required when codePackagePathInImageStore is specified. This path is created relative to the root directory in the image store and used as the destination for the code package copy.

summary.para: Copies the cluster manifest file and/or Service Fabric code package to the image store.

remarks.para: Both source cluster manifest path and source code path cannot be null.

exception.para: There was an error accessing a file on the image store.
A required file was not found on the image store.
A required directory was not found on the image store.
A path to an image store file/directory was too long.
: There was an IO error communicating with the image store.
The request timed out but may have already been accepted for processing by the system.

MemberSignature.Value: public System.Threading.Tasks.Task DeactivateNodeAsync (string nodeName, System.Fabric.NodeDeactivationIntent deactivationIntent);
.method public hidebysig instance class System.Threading.Tasks.Task DeactivateNodeAsync(string nodeName, valuetype System.Fabric.NodeDeactivationIntent deactivationIntent) cil managed
Public Function DeactivateNodeAsync (nodeName As String, deactivationIntent As NodeDeactivationIntent) As Task
member this.DeactivateNodeAsync : string * System.Fabric.NodeDeactivationIntent -> System.Threading.Tasks.Task

param.name: nodeName
param.para: The name of the node to deactivate.

param.name: deactivationIntent
param.para: The for deactivating the node.

summary.para: Deactivates a particular node with the specified .

returns.para: A Task that represents the asynchronous acknowledgment of the request.

remarks.para: When this API completes it implies that the intent to deactivate has been registered by the system. It does not mean that the deactivation is complete. The progress of the operation can be determined by using the API

Once the deactivation is in progress, the deactivation intent can be “increased” but not decreased (for example, a node which is was deactivated with the intent can be deactivated further with , but not the other way around. Nodes may be reactivated via any time after they are deactivated. If the deactivation is not complete this will cancel the deactivation. A node which goes down and comes back up while deactivated will still need to be reactivated before services will be placed on that node.
Service Fabric ensures that deactivation is a 'safe' process. It performs several safety checks (see ) to ensure that there is no loss of availability or data

exception.para: See for handling common FabricClient failures.
See for handling common FabricClient failures.
See also for handling common FabricClient failures.

public System.Threading.Tasks.Task RemoveNodeStateAsync (string nodeName);
.method public hidebysig instance class System.Threading.Tasks.Task RemoveNodeStateAsync(string nodeName) cil managed
Public Function RemoveNodeStateAsync (nodeName As String) As Task
member this.RemoveNodeStateAsync : string -> System.Threading.Tasks.Task

param.name: nodeName
param.para: The name of the node which has been permanently lost.

summary.para: Indicates that the persisted data of a node is lost (e.g., due to disk failure, or reimage, etc.), and that Service Fabric should treat any services or state on that node as lost and unrecoverable.

returns.para: A task representing the operation.

remarks.para: After a node goes down, Service Fabric will keep track of replicas of persisted services on that node as they have state on that node.

In cases where the administrator knows that the persisted state on a node has been permanently lost the method should be called ... to notify Service Fabric that the state on the node is gone (or the node can never come back with the state it had).
This instructs Service Fabric to stop waiting for that node (and any persisted replicas on that node) to recover.
NOTE: This API must be called only after it has been determined that the state on that node has been lost.
Starting from Service Fabric 6.5, in order to use this API for seed nodes, please change the seed nodes to regular (non-seed) nodes and then invoke this API to remove the node state.

If the cluster is running on Azure, after the seed node goes down, Service Fabric will try to change it to a non-seed node automatically. To make this happen, make sure the number of non-seed nodes in the primary node type is no less than the number of Down seed nodes. If necessary, add more nodes to the primary node type to achieve this.
For standalone cluster, if the Down seed node is not expected to come back up with its state intact, please remove the node from the cluster, See
If this API is called and then the node comes back with its state intact it is Undefined Behavior

exception.para: See for handling common FabricClient failures.
See for handling common FabricClient failures.
See also for handling common FabricClient failures.

param.name: enabled
param.para: A boolean value, which if true causes reporting when a replica is unabled to be placed.

summary.para: Toggles whether the Cluster Resource Balancer will report a health warning when it's unable to place a replica.

returns.para: The task associated with this async method.

remarks.para: If this method is called twice with the value false, it clears from memory the reports that would potentially have been emitted. If this method is called with the value true, the Cluster Resource Balancer will report a health warning when it's unable to place a replica. If such health warnings are blocking a monitored upgrade's health checks the toggle can be switched off.

returns.para: The unprovisioned Service Fabric.

remarks.para: A null value is permitted for either the parameter or the parameter. A null value cannot be used for both parameters.

This will delete the patch file and/or cluster manifest file from the image store location. The image store location is specified as a configuration setting in the cluster manifest that was provided when the cluster was created.

exception.para: The object is in a closed state. Dispose of the object you are using and instantiate a new object.
